class abstract_logger.AbstractDelayed[source]#

Bases: AbstractLogger

Subclass of AbstractLogger of when the abstract class gives the result only at the end using yield_results

None

abstract yield_results(dict_elements_arguments, **kwargs)[source]#

This method is how the user wants to see the log file.

See also blueprints.py that contains examples.

  • kwargs –

class blueprints.PandasSQLLoggerBlueprint[source]#

Bases: AbstractDelayed

Blueprint for a log as the form of a SQL Table using pandas

log_item(item, message, **kwargs)[source]#

Log method (abstract) delayed

Parameters:

  • item – item to log about

  • message – message to print

  • kwargs –

Returns:

None

yield_results(dict_elements_arguments, **kwargs) → None[source]#

Pandas export to SQL. By default, the behaviour when the path/table already exists is to append, but this can be modified internally.

Parameters:

dict_elements_arguments – Contains in key “PANDAS_COLUMNS”

the columns to use for pd.DataFrame.from_records, in key “SQL_FILE” the SQL file and in “SQL_TABLE” the table name.
